chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick C. Domka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $679 Restitution to West Side Mobil, joint and several.
Pay $1.49 Restitution - for 15CM-12.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time.

No contact with South Side BP, West Side Mobil, Larry Flatoff or Ms. Judee Rasmussen.
No contact with Crystal Domka or Kenneth Groholski unless it is approved in advance by the agent.
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal substances.

Maintain absolute sobriety for duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. If Defendant has a valid prescription, only take as prescribed in writing.
Complete psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatments, and programming deemed appropriate by the  DOC.
Sign releases of information forms for assesments, medications/pharmacies and  treatment so agent may monitor treatment and use of prescription medications if any.
Provide agent  with a list of any medications. 
All prescription medications, if any,  are to come from one pharmacy.
Submit a DNA sample if not done so.
Complete AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick C. Domka in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Derrick C. Domka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-348, 14CF-467 and 14CF-469

2:03 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a sentencing.

There is no reason why Defendant should not be sentenced this afternoon.
Parties are prepared to proceed.

Court has reviewed the PSI.

State has no corrections as to PSI.
Atty Kryshak has no corrections as to PSI.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, presents a victim impact statement for 14CF-348.
The dismissed and read in case has about $1.49 in restitution, State addresses this for the record.
State addresses other restitution.

Court has read the letter from Defendant's mother. 
Court has read the victim impact statement regarding the west side mobil property.

Court addresses the parties, has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

14CF-348:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for a period of 10 years
5 years initial confinement
5 years extended supervision
Conditions:
No contact with South Side BP, West Side Mobil, Larry Flatoff or Ms. Judee Rasmussen
No contact with Crystal Domka or Kenneth Groholski unless it is approved in advance by the agent
Maintain absolute sobriety for duration of supervision
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. If Defendant has a valid prescription, only take as prescribed in writing
Complete AODA assessment and comply with recommendations
Complete psychological assessment and comply with recommendations
Comply with any other assessments, treatments, and programming deemed appropriate by the  DOC
Sign releases of information forms for assesments, medications/pharmacies and  treatment so agent may monitor treatment and use of prescription medications if any
Provide agent  with a list of any medications 
All prescription medications, if any,  are to come from one pharmacy
Pay all court costs  90 days prior to discharge of supervision
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal substances
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Submit a DNA sample if not done so
Pay $679 Restitution to West Side Mobil, joint and several 
Pay $1.49 Restitution - for 15CM-12 
Restitution to be paid out of prison account at the rate of 25%

14CF-467:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for a period of 6 years
3 years initial confinement
3 years extended supervision
Consecutive to 14CF-348
Eligible for Earned Release Program on this case only
403 days credit
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-348
Pay costs 90 days prior to discharge of supervision

14CF-469:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for a period of 4 years
2 years initial confinement
2 years extended supervision
Concurrent to 14CF-348 and Concurrent to 14CF-467
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-348 and 14CF-467
Pay costs 90 days prior to discharge of supervision

Court advises Defendant as to felony conviction regarding deportation, voting and body armor.
Appeal rights have been filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick C. Domka in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Derrick C. Domka in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-467, 15CM-12, 14CF-348 and 14CF-469.

4:20 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Parties anticipate doing the plea only today, argued sentencing and PSI.

14CF-348: State has filed an amended information, amending Count 1.
Defendant will plead to amended charge. Counts 2, 3, and 4 would be dismissed and rad in
14CF-467: Defendant will plead to Count 1 as charged. Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 would be dismissed and read in
14CF-469: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in
15CM-12: Would be dismissed and read in.

Atty Kryshak concurs.

Defendant has received a copy of the amended information in 14CF-348.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant waives reading of information.

Defendant enters plea of: GUILTY 14CF-348 Count 1
Defendant enters plea of: GUILTY 14CF-467 Count 1
Defendant enters plea of: GUILTY 14CF-469 Count 1

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Court takes a moment to review the complaints.
Defendant acknowledges previous convictions for retail theft.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-348: Count 1: 943.32(1)(a)  939.05
14CF-348: Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-467: Count 1: 943.10(1)(a)  939.62(1)(c)
14CF-467: Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-469: Count 1: 943.23(2)  939.62(1)(b)
14CF-469: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-12: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the PSI. 
Sentencing will be scheduled after 60 days.
